metadata.name: HackTool - SharpWSUS/WSUSpendu Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of SharpWSUS or WSUSpendu, utilities that allow for lateral movement through WSUS. Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is a critical component of Windows systems and is frequently configured in a way that allows an attacker to circumvent internal networking limitations.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -inject ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -payloadargs ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -payloadfile '))) OR (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' approve ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' create ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' check ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' delete '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /payload:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /payload=')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /updateid:')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /updateid=')))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of SharpWSUS or WSUSpendu, utilities that allow for lateral movement through WSUS. Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is a critical component of Windows systems and is frequently configured in a way that allows an attacker to circumvent internal networking limitations.
